## Purpose
Abstract base class defining the interface for handling installable Python artifacts in pip's distribution system. Establishes the contract that all concrete distribution implementations must follow.

## Key Components

**AbstractDistribution (L11-53)** - Main abstract base class
- Constructor takes `InstallRequirement` and stores as `self.req` (L30-32)
- Defines interface for distribution metadata handling and build tracking

**Abstract Properties & Methods:**
- `build_tracker_id` (L34-40) - Property returning unique build tracker identifier or None
- `get_metadata_distribution()` (L42-44) - Must return `BaseDistribution` instance
- `prepare_distribution_metadata()` (L46-53) - Handles metadata preparation with finder, isolation, and dependency checking parameters

## Dependencies
- Uses `BaseDistribution` from `pip._internal.metadata.base` for metadata representation
- Requires `InstallRequirement` from `pip._internal.req` as constructor parameter
- TYPE_CHECKING import of `PackageFinder` for method signatures

## Architectural Patterns
- Abstract Base Class pattern with `abc.ABCMeta` metaclass
- Template Method pattern - defines interface structure for subclasses
- Separation of concerns between build tracking and metadata operations

## Key Constraints
- Requirement name must be determinable for non-upgrade cases
- Setup requirements must be resolvable without additional package installations
- Must support unique build tracker identification
- Metadata must be accessible through Distribution object interface

## Design Notes
- Build tracker integration is optional (build_tracker_id can return None)
- Metadata preparation is conditional on build tracker participation
- Interface supports both build isolation and dependency checking modes
